features: Collaborate with family or friends to assemble this 651-Piece mecha building toy to bring relationships closer and strengthen communication. This product is not suitable for children aged 12 and below.
This Nifeliz Brinoac display set features a harmonious and aesthetically pleasing color combination of sky blue and white, exuding a distinctive charm.
With one hand holding combat equipment, the other hand sporting a Composite Armor Shield, and its shoulders armed with Cluster NAD Mines, this mecha toy stands ready for any battle.
With simulated joint components integrated into its chest, hips, and limbs, the Nifeliz Brinoac building set offers the flexibility to pose in various ways.
This Nifeliz mecha construction toy comes in a stylish cardboard box along with a clear assembly manual, making it ideal for gift giving.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: JOY AND ACCOMPLISHMENT OF BUILDING The Nifeliz Brinoac building set truly empowers you to explore and express your imagination while enjoying the excitement of building. The harmonious color schemes and sleek lines of this mecha building set contribute to its visual appeal.
Previous page Next page 1 VARIOUS COMBAT POSTURES 2 COMBAT EQUIPMENT 3 COMPOSITE ARMOR SHIELD 4 CLUSTER NAD MINE 5 LAUNCHERS
Nifeliz Mecha An Inspiring Gift for Teens For teens, this personalized mecha building toy offers an opportunity to enhance their cognitive skills and problem-solving abilities.

How many pieces does it come with? The Nifeliz Brinoac building set is composed of 651 pieces. What are the dimensions of the completed model mecha? Once assembled, Nifeliz Brinoac measures 6.85 x 4.01 x 9.13 inches. How long is the estimated time to complete the build? This mecha model set requires approximately 2 hours for assembly. Is the instruction manual easy to follow? Yes, the Nifeliz Brinoac construction toy includes a clear instruction manual with detailed, easy to follow.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not quite lego but good enough
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This was an interesting build. At first I thought the instructions were not well put together but I had to take that back. The instructions for this mech was well documented. The one thing that threw me off early was the none numbered bags which I was used to with legos. My recommendations for anyone building these rhe first time is to sort the piece out first then start building. Note there are no extra pieces with these packs it's all or nothing. Every piece in the package is used. My one complaint was for some of the interlocks for 3 key areas which ads support which were a bit flimsy and I may make my own adjustments to make it more stable but aside from that this was a great kit and I will seek out the other sets from this mech collection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice looking mecha construction set.
reviews.reviewText: This model is very well designed, as not only does it look great, but it is able to stand on its own, provided it is posed correctly in accordance with the posing guide within the instruction manual. One potential issue is that there are no extra pieces included in the set, but as long as you don't lose any parts, it should not be a problem.Overall I think that this is an excellent model, even if can be difficult to assemble at times, due to the small parts and complex design.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good, but some flaws.
reviews.reviewText: I've had +/- experiences with Nifeliz. On one hand, many of their products, including this one, have a good visual appeal, but on other hand, you may be missing pieces. As near as I can tell, I am missing maybe one piece from this particular set. It was more for decoration than any actual structural importance though. From the outset, the pieces come in several sealed bags, but they aren't split into major building parts like one would see with a more traditional LEGO set. This by itself is no big deal, I would recommend to have a decently sized area to spread and organize pieces though. I really liked the design and while the build is a bit tedious you are left with a pretty good looking product. But due to the design, not the bricks themselves, some parts may fall apart or just not hold together well secondary to weight or poor design (or both). I think this could be overcome with some small tweaks though so again not necessarily a big deal unless you want this for more than a show piece. Mine is in a display cabinet so maybe I'll fix some of the more structural issues (e.g. the feet tend to come a part with slight jostling). Overall I'm happy with what I've got and I think the price was reasonable. Though you could probably find it cheaper on Aliexpress if you don't mind waiting longer for it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bags aren’t numbered so it’s a 600+ piece scramble. Parts didn’t fit together well and how it’s instructed makes for weird connections that make fragile. By page 4 there was a missing piece. If you wanted to take the time and make it better you could, but at that point just build your own and save the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Really Awesome Lego Mech
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Really wish there was something like this when I was a kid cuz this is probably the most sickest mech “lego”Pose-ability is very flexible, only cons:- No numbered bags - basically have to open all of them, sort by color then find each piece per step… If this was numbered, could easily finish this in maybe under 1 hour or so- Some weak articulations point, weak connections - Most obvious that comes to mind is the articulation of the arms, specifically the part that allows flexion/extension (google if you want to know what i mean). It’s secured only by 2x 1x1 bricks. Another example is the back part of the cannon (or howitzer per the booklet), its white cylinder piece, its only connection is a circle 1x1 (or maybe it’s 0.5x1) brick, comes off easily. Would definitely need to reinforce these weak points with some kind of adhesive.- Brick quality - the bricks could definitely use some quality control, one example is the brick that connects to a ball, there’s like left over plastic (i’ll add photos later)Overall, I really like it and would definitely buy the other mechs but these issues really prevent it from being a full 5 star in my book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I found myself enjoying this set a lot, both building it and even just looking at it. The instructions were detailed and came with side information about the lore behind the build, which I thought was neat. The pieces you get are final, so if you lose some wamp wamp, but I believe they're 1:1 to official legos, so you could probably replace them. Building the mech was fun and I was able to do it in a night, unfortunately as the other reviews state, no numbered bags for building order. Me personally I separated the colors in their own piles. Yadda yadda, pose-ability is really fun but a little funky. Some joints are a lil loose but tweak around and it'll be perfect. Also the value is amazing, 36ish dollars after shipping to what should be a 50ish(maybe) dollar set is awesome.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great design but flawed execution
reviews.reviewText: Pros:• Great design with clever use of bricks and color separation• Instruction manual is clear and well presented• A fun build experience• Built in port in the hips for potential display standCons:• Poor brick quality with no extra pieces• While the range of articulation is decent the ball joints don’t have the strength to maintain more dynamic poses• Some more delicate areas (eg. the head) are prone to coming apart easily.Overall:Final product reminds me of early Master Grade Gundam kits - intriguing designs with a clear vision that looks great in a static pose, but hampered by the limitations of the materials and over reliance on ball joints. The line shows great promise but needs refinement, maybe using more clips and bars for added friction in the joints, or else downsizing the designs. The final piece looks good and has great presence on the shelf, but the sheer size/mass creates its own problems.I would have happily paid more for these designs with better brick quality and a few extra pieces of some of the more exotic bricks.Overall 6/10, looking forward to future mech designs from this team.
La caja del producto viene rota, la cita de los costados está intacta pero el empaque está roto al parecer por golpe.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It's alright but overall the quality is quite bad. Half the time the pieces don't even fit together they dont always ship the right amount of bricks. They also just give you all the pieces in bags without labelling them so you just have a mountain of bricks. The mech is really faulty. 1 leg is tight and the other is really loose. And sometimes the top half just breaks off. Impossible to even model! Only buy if tou want to make a moc or just for pieces. Do better nifeliz....

Vorab: Die Bewertung bezieht sich auf den Bausatz für den Blue Brinoac bzw. Brino AC (oder einfach gesagt: der mit großem Schild und Gewehr)Das Set hat insgesamt einen ganz guten Eindruck gemacht. Die Verpackung war schlicht aber schick gestaltet, die Anleitung hochwertig gedruckt und beinhaltet außerdem ein paar kleine Details zum Designer und dem Mecha, was nett zu lesen war und schön auf den Bau eingestimmt hat. Das erste Manko fällt dann aber auf, wenn man die Box öffnet und die Tüten herausnimmt. Diese sind nämlich leider nicht beschriftet, was den Zusammenbau etwas in die Länge zieht. Ich würde empfehlen die Steine am Anfang der Farbe nach zu sortieren, so habe ich mir beim 2. Mecha einiges an Zeit gespart. Speziell mit diesem Mecha hatte ich auch bei der Anleitung Probleme die blauen und grauen Steine zu unterscheiden und musste öfters mit Handy-Taschenlampe genauer leuchten um die Farben unterscheiden zu können. Auch wenn ich vorsichtig war, habe ich am Ende doch 2-3 Steine gehabt die farblich nicht zu der Anleitung gepasst haben. Das hat dem Endprodukt aber keinen Abbruch getan. Schade find ich eher dass der Mecha, fertig zusammengebaut, sehr fragile ist. Ich weiß natürlich nicht ob das immer so ist, aber die Gelenke sind etwas zu leichtgängig was einige Positionierungen schwierig gestaltet. Nichtsdestotrotz sieht der fertig gebaute Mecha wirklich cool aus und lässt sich mit etwas Feingefühl dennoch schön in Pose bringen. Für das Problem bei der Stabilität ziehe ich einen Stern ab, die anderen Kritikpunkte gewichte ich jedoch nicht so stark, sodass insgesamt ein guter Gesamteindruck bleibt, sofern man die kleinen Abstriche brim Komfort im Vergleich zum großen Konkurrenten verkraften kann.
